head.title: Paper Reinstates Writer Who Likened Politician to Hitler

hedline.hl1: Paper Reinstates Writer Who Likened Politician to Hitler

abstract.p: Queens Ledger publisher Walter Sanchez reinstates columnist Frank Borzellieri, who likened Board of Education member Terry Thompson to Hitler, but says he will keep close check on his columns (M)

block.p: Walter Sanchez, the publisher of The Queens Ledger, has reinstated a columnist who compared Terri Thomson, the Queens representative to the city's Board of Education, to Hitler. The writer, Frank Borzellieri, was suspended after a column with that comparison appeared in July.

Walter Sanchez, the publisher of The Queens Ledger, has reinstated a columnist who compared Terri Thomson, the Queens representative to the city's Board of Education, to Hitler. The writer, Frank Borzellieri, was suspended after a column with that comparison appeared in July.
''Many of my readers are genuinely attracted to the information and the viewpoint that his column gives,'' Mr. Sanchez said, explaining the reinstatement. ''We got nearly 50 letters on it.''

Mr. Sanchez, who acknowledged that he had not read the July column before it was printed, said he would now be ''closely checking his columns'' because ''there is a good deal of trust that is gone between Frank and I.''
Mr. Sanchez said he had tried unsuccessfully to reach Ms. Thomson, whom he called a friend, to apologize. As to whether they were still friends, he said, ''I guess not.''
Mr. Borzellieri did not apologize for his words.
''She can be his best friend,'' he said of Mr. Sanchez and Ms. Thomson. ''It doesn't change the fact that she's evil.''

Howie Katz, director of the New York regional office of the Anti-Defamation League, wrote to The Ledger complaining about what Mr. Borzellieri had written. Mr. Katz called the Hitler analogy ''gratuitous, ignorant and deeply offensive,'' saying it ''trivialized the Holocaust.''
Vicki Streitfeld, a spokeswoman for the Board of Education, said Ms. Thomson declined to comment on the issue.
